page.title: 01Hill-land Lying East Aber'n
page.content: This block lies just off the main road, running for the most part north and south and just off the western edge of the area. Only in its south-western corner, however, does the road cut into the block. Moving eastward from the western extremities the first feature encountered is a narrow strip of cultivated farm-land, the possessions of a single tier of forms that line the road has a common access. Several of the farm-houses, however, lie outside the block and the farm lands contained within it are consequently very restricted. They slope gently upwards towards the edge of the moors which cover the hills that rise to several summits of about 500m. The cultivated land has an altitude, on the average of about 250m. Rotation crops of grain, turnips and grass are grown and the main
